title: Link to the Sky

content:
GRB 230307A # My Nature article A lanthanide-rich kilonova in the aftermath of a long gamma-ray burst was covered by multiple news outlets and social media worldwide. Below is a selection of media coverage:
IAA-CSIC: Observan por primera vez la formación de ‘tierras raras’ tras la fusión de dos estrellas de neutrones INAF: Kilonove, fabbriche di metalli pesanti SPACE: James Webb Space Telescope finds neutron star mergers forge gold in the cosmos: 'It was thrilling' Tor Vergata: Kilonove, fabbriche di metalli pesanti Weltraum Aktuell: Kilonova statt Supernova 史上第二亮的伽马暴：重金属合成器 Track research impact in This study was honoured with a Special Mention in the Premio Giovani Ricercatrici e Ricercatori 2025 (Young Researchers Award 2025).
Other media mentions # Selected press coverage of my collaborative research work.
Astronomers at Nanjing University propose a new origin for a peculiar gamma-ray burst 天文与空间科学学院博士生在《自然》发表论文，发现长伽马射线暴与千新星成协，提出新的前身星模型 2020 Breakthrough of the year 入选2020年度十大科学发现！这项研究南大团队深度参与 等你在下一个238天： 银河系磁陀星SGR J1935+2154的X射线爆发事件的周期分析

#

My Nature article A lanthanide-rich kilonova in the aftermath of a long gamma-ray burst was covered by multiple news outlets and social media worldwide. Below is a selection of media coverage:
title: Press

content: As of October 2025, I am the author or co-author of 25 refereed publications in journals such as ApJ, A&A, Nature, and Science, with 1,000+ citations and an h-index of 16 according to the astrophysics data system (ADS). My publications are shown below and can also be accessed through ads | | . First-Author # Yu-Han Yang, Eleonora Troja, Brendan O’Connor, et al., Nature, 626, 742–745 (2024). title: Talks

content:
Hi, my name is Yu-Han Yang (杨雨涵). I was born in 1994 in Sichuan Province, China.
At the China University of Geosciences in Wuhan, I earned a Bachelor of Science in Physics. I then pursued graduate studies at Nanjing University, where I obtained both my Master’s degree in astrophysics under the supervision of Prof. Zi-Gao Dai, and my PhD in astronomy advised by Prof. Bin-Bin Zhang. Currently, I am a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Rome Tor Vergata, working in collaboration with Dr. Eleonora Troja.
My research uses telescopes to chase cosmic explosions across the universe.

content:
The General Coordinates Network (GCN) is a public collaboration platform run by NASA for the astronomy research community to share alerts and rapid communications about high-energy, multimessenger, and transient phenomena.
Below are some of the GCN circulars that include my contributions.
Yu-Han Yang, Eleonora Troja, Massine El Kabir, Muskan Yadav, 2025, GCN 42517 Muskan Yadav, Roberto Ricci, Yu-Han Yang, Rosa L. summary:
The General Coordinates Network (GCN) is a public collaboration platform run by NASA for the astronomy research community to share alerts and rapid communications about high-energy, multimessenger, and transient phenomena.

Below are some of the GCN circulars that include my contributions.
title: GCNs

content:
My research journey began with a strong emphasis on the physical interpretation of transients and gradually expanded to include observations and data analysis.
The primary area of my interest is time-domain astronomy, including gamma-ray bursts (GRBs), fast radio bursts (FRBs), gravitational wave (GW) events and their electromagnetic counterparts.

title: Research
